column2: Role & responsibilities   Vendor Management:  Develop and maintain relationships with suppliers and vendors to ensure timely procurement of materials and products. Sourcing:  Identify new suppliers and products that meet quality standards, pricing targets, and project specifications. Negotiation:  Negotiate pricing, terms, and contracts with suppliers to achieve cost savings and favorable terms for the company. Purchase Orders:  Generate purchase orders accurately and efficiently, ensuring alignment with project timelines and budgetary constraints. Inventory Management:  Monitor inventory levels and track materials and products from procurement to delivery, minimizing stockouts and excess inventory. Quality Control:  Collaborate with the quality assurance team to ensure that purchased materials and products meet quality standards and specifications. Cost Analysis:  Analyze pricing trends, market conditions, and supplier performance to identify opportunities for cost optimization and process improvement. Compliance:  Ensure compliance with company policies, industry regulations, and legal requirements related to procurement and vendor management. Documentation:  Maintain accurate records of purchases, contracts, and vendor communications, ensuring transparency and accountability in the procurement process. Team Collaboration:  Collaborate closely with project managers, designers, and other stakeholders to understand project requirements and coordinate procurement activities accordingly. Preferred candidate profile   Preferred candidate will be having 5+ years of experience in the Purchase function of an Interior Design / Turnkey Contractor / Project Management / Real Estate or related industry. Perks and benefits   Alternate Saturdays Off.

column2: Handles, controls, and monitors all Procurement and if required Purchasing activities in a project.      Establishes and maintains preferred supplier lists (e.g., FPL) and introduces Procurement/Sourcing strategies targeting maximum contribution to the operating result under the consideration of product/service availability & quality and guaranteeing the observance of the Procurement processes described and optimizing deployment of resources.            1. Early Involvement during sales phase      Review and monitor the sales funnel (e.g. Philos, etc.) in order to ensure the involvement of Procurement.      Meet with cross-functional partners and participate in project/sales meetings to provide procurement market and preferred supplier information at an early stage to optimize supplier selection, internal workflows and processes.      2. Project Procurement standards      Establish proper sourcing processes, control all Procurement resources & activities in the project or area of responsibility and inform all involved within Procurement to deliver optimum impact for the business (Procurement plan, target-costing) & Procurement targets and meet requirements relating to budget, availability, and quality. Apply Procurement regulations as per Compliance, organization standards and PM@Siemens.      3. Analysis      Analyze scope of supply, contractual obligations and exactly understand customer s functional needs      Identify particular Procurement risks, opportunities, potential changes, claims and market forces during the entire project, together with Commodity Management, to avoid potential damage / exploit potential.      Provide categorization of prevailing risks at PM040.      4. Bid preparation / Contribution to increased hit rate      Support project calculation with reliable and up-to-data cost data.      Include (supplier) innovations and preferred supplier/product portfolios that improve Siemens cost position and/or the customers benefit.      5. Strategy definition and implementation      Derive Procurement strategies for assigned projects in accordance with Business and BU-wide Procurement strategies and ensure their implementation (in particular pooling or utilization of master contracts), as well as identify solution approaches and improvement potentials to ensure alignment with the strategic Procurement targets as well as overall business strategies.      6. Negotiation      Lead contractual and price negotiations and/or support the specialist buyers responsible for particular material fields (in particular those not covered by any Commodity Management) to secure project targets with optimum conditions e.g. Total Cost of Ownership (ToCO). Conduct eSourcing activities on the basis of ANC.      7. Contract Management      Ensure that mitigation of Procurement risks, changes to original scope of supply and potential claims (towards customers and suppliers) are covered in valid contracts. Ensure that contractual obligations towards the customer that must be fulfilled by supplier are covered in a way that mitigates the own risk exposure.      8. Project Controlling / Reporting      Clarify internal indicators for project controlling and compile all relevant information to submit qualified reports (e.g. for the project team, Procurement management). Proactively ensure resources availability, status, transparency and alerting of deviations.      9. Supplier Management / Preferred Supplier List      Establish/apply preferred supplier list, provide supplier information to the project team, conduct supplier qualifications & project-specific supplier evaluations (project evaluations) and supplier development activities. Follow-up with suppliers in regards to NCC costs.      10. Knowledge management and documentation      Be proactive and forward systematically all relevant Procurement information (e.g. updated contractual conditions, Supplier Management data) to keep all project participants and relevant cross-functional partners up to date. Sensitize cross-functional partners for Procurement related practices processes and metrics.
column11: Procurement, commodity management, Costing, Claims, Contract management, Project control, Project management, Siemens, Supplier management, Supplier development

column2: Represents Procurement in Project Management Team.          Integrates Procurement in the project management process and project teams at an early involvement during sales phase.          Establish proper sourcing processes, control Procurement activities in the project and inform all involved within Procurement to deliver optimum impact for the business (Procurement plan, target-costing) relating to budget, availability, timeline and quality.        Detailed Profile -               Support with correct cost for 3rd party procurement scope while Bid preparation and contribute to increase the hit rate.         Identify Particular Procurement risks, opportunities, potential challenges, claims and market forces during the entire project, together with Commodity Management, to avoid potential damage / exploit potential.         Preparation of Procurement plan BID Execution. Analyzes scope of supply and contract agreements, carries out risk analyses and introduces negotiation recommendations.         Drives Procurement strategies in projects and ensures their implementation of KPI s like CNI, CTG, E Bidding / Auction PTE etc         Support in getting best rates during execution phase         Include supplier innovations, value engineering and preferred supplier/product portfolios that improve Siemens cost position.         Use of various advance negotiation concept to identify right product at correct cost         Supplier Evaluation, Qualification, development and Management         Contract Mgmt.:- Ensure that major Procurement risks, changes to original scope of supply and potential claims (towards customers and suppliers) are covered in valid contracts. Be proactive and forward systematically all relevant Procurement information (eg updated contractual conditions, Supplier Management data) to keep all project participants and relevant cross-functional partners up to date. Sensitize cross-functional partners for Procurement related practices processes and metrics. column2: You will be responsible for the procurement activities in our HVDC tenders.         You will have a key role interacting with HVDC stakeholders in tender, i.e. engineering, R&D,service, tender management, project management, general management levels at HVDC and the global SCM organization.         You will be on the driving seat for any needs or issues related to supply chain, engaging other departments (engineering, documentation, finance, etc.) to receive the input needed for your Tender.         Perform cost calculation on the material, resources, and other costs related to SCM scope.         Provide feedback to tender team related to time schedule, terms & conditions, payment milestones, customer requirements, perform risk assessment from SCM perspective.         Connect with SCM category managers and the suppliers, for at least but not limited to, Request for Quotation (RFQ), negotiation, discussing special customer requirements.         Contribute to strategic work, lessons learned, and continuous improvement.         Tender Management: Adhere to internal processes with flexibility to adapt solutions to project specifics.          Attend Project Kick-off Meeting and Tender Team Meetings as SCM representative.          Obtain and check for completeness and correctness of all relevant Tender information, to comply with both internal processes and Client requirements         Communicate with relevant Engineering Teams for clarification of scope and technical issues, Communicate with Sales Department for clarification of commercial issues         Maintain understanding of the Tender s technical evolution including Bill of Quantities (BOQ).         Analyze customer specifications and internal engineering documentation with regard to SCM Scope, Prepares all relevant Tender-Project specific Documentation as per customer / Internal requirements, seeks approval as per Approval-Process and submits the same together with the approved Cost Calculation, Participate in handover of successful Tenders to Project Execution.          Active support in market development in collaboration with Category Team.         ?To ensures compliance with rules and regulations within the team. To identify customer needs, price analysis, offer and negotiate in order to secure order.         Communication: Establishes clear and transparent communication between Supplier and Tender team.         Contributes to vendor list management by providing Supplier Performance data. Ensure that our suppliers comply with the laws, regulations, standards, certificates and directives that Hitachi Energy requires from their suppliers.         Establishes clear and transparent communication internally, externally, and between different Divisions, Business Units and Functions and supports the implementation of PL activities and initiatives in the Region/Country through this clear communication.         Living Hitachi Energy core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business.               Your Background :           Have an academic degree in a relevant field: BE (Electrical), Supply Chain Management or equivalent experience.         Should have 6 to 10 years of experience of Tender management, Project management or procurement, genuinely interested in technical components and systems.         You are used to a multicultural and challenging global business environment and can handle several tasks in parallel.         Described as energetic, motivated and self-confident person who can handle both ups and downs and manage problem that may occur.         Preferably you have some years of relevant working experience so that you feel comfortable in taking decisions, questioning and take full responsibility for outcome of the work in your project by the SCM organization.         You are a team player with strong communicative and collaborative skills, and you are comfortable with thinking outside of the box.         We think that you are energetic, endurant, structured, and independent. You are open to changes, value integrity, get things done in a timely manner, and always drive for efficiency.         You should be comfortable in expressing yourself, written and spoken, in English.         Experience in HVDC project will be an added advantage.

column2: Role:? PPM - Purchase Procurement?Manager Location:? Chennai, CTC: Negotiable? Qualification and experience:?Bachelors degree Minimum of 10 years experience in Sourcing, Procurement, project management/execution of large capital projects, preferably with an Engineering, Procurement, and Construction company. Payroll - Randstad? Job Overview: The PPM is a planning and implementation role in the Strategic Sourcing Center serves as the primary interface between Global Purchasing, the Dow Business, JV, or 3rd?party affiliate Company, and the owner project team for the sourcing and purchasing of all equipment commodities, materials, and construction labor and services for a project.? The PPM is a key member of the project team and actively leads, influences, and engages to help determine overall project procurement needs, and presents these needs and opportunities to Dows Global MRO/Capital Category Leaders, Sourcing Managers, Sourcing Specialists, and EPC Directors and/or EPC Contract Managers, as applicable, such that optimum contracting and/or sourcing opportunities on their assigned projects are established and executed successfully.? The PPM provides support on Dow Model A execution projects (internally executed projects with Dow Engineering Solutions) and/or Model B and C execution, where the EPC or EPCm services are outsourced to a 3rd?party EPC/EPCm company. Responsibilities: Ensures that strategic sourcing activities and procurement operating discipline are followed to help assure project efficiency and purchasing effectiveness. As a key member of the project team, the PPM helps determine overall project needs, and presents these needs and opportunities to Strategic Sourcing Center team, e.g., Category Leaders, Sourcing Managers,? Sourcing Specialists, EPC Directors? and EPC Contract Managers. Provides consulting, training, guidance, and leadership as a key project team member in support of capital or expense projects, as applicable, including potential business account relationships. Positively impacts project strategy through detailed working knowledge of Dow systems, business policies, procedures, ethics, legal issues and external suppliers. Identifies strategic value contribution opportunities and defines value contribution projects based on business discussions and interfaces with the business and/or project. Identifies aggregation opportunities for Category Leader or Sourcing Manager negotiations. Verifies that appropriate attention is given to all aspects of procurement by monitoring information and conformity to established practices. Coordinates the identification of suppliers capable of meeting Dow's needs. Develops customized project procurement plan(s) and instructions for each project and distributes to Purchasing and project personnel. Develops and manages customized Project Supply Plan(s) as a control document. Plans, schedules and ensures that procurement schedules are compatible with project schedules, risk management plans and especially-critical equipment and construction labor. Advises the project team members of delivery schedules that directly impact the project schedule. Directs purchasing activities to maximize protection of company assets through proper use of legal documents such as service agreements, indemnity agreements and others. Balances legal considerations with project needs in making business decisions, utilizing the concept of "appropriate risk" as a tool in taking action after weighing alternatives. Leads or coordinates effort for the project team to resolve claims and disputes against Dow or by Dow against suppliers. Intervenes with suppliers on performance issues at the request of the project team, and in consultation with the appropriate Strategic Sourcing Center representative. Maintains basic knowledge of suppliers and relevant market developments such as mergers and acquisitions, financial status and changes in key personnel. Coordinates to resolve equipment procurement problems, together with Construction Management, during the construction stage of the project as applicable. In order to maintain client satisfaction with the businesses and project teams, travel will be required including, but not limited to short-term business trips.? Flexibility is required for trips that may be associated with EPC management.? Travel could include international assignments.

column2: The Project Procurement Manager (PPM) is responsible for Supply Chain activities performed during the project and he/she ensures that services, equipment and materials under Supply Chain (SC) scope are free issued to fabrication yards as per project requirements in terms of safety, cost, schedule and quality.      For all Equipment under Project Management Office (PMO) responsibility, PPM shall provide support to PMO during RFQ phase by leading the buyer team and during the PO execution by providing the Post Order Management (POM) support required by PMO.      The PPM supervises the SC team assigned to the project.      He/she reports progress of the SC Purchase Orders and associated activities to the Project Management Team (PMT), local Supply Chain manager and if required, to the Client representative.            ROLE CONTRIBUTION          1. In order that effective procurement control is established from the beginning of the Execution Phase you are to:        1.1 For the Supply Chain scope, develop the Project Procurement Strategy during the Win Phase with Category Managers, local SC Manager, SBM Operations representative and cascade this to the project SC team.    1.2 Define solutions to address identified clients requirements (eg POs STC set up, "back to back" solutions).    1.3 Define SBM Operations requirement to be considered in the SC strategy.    1.4 Define in coordination with the relevant Category Manager(s) the most appropriate strategy to be implemented for strategic scopes/vendors    1.5 Assess SC project risk and identify associated mitigation actions    1.6 Define lead-time and values for Supply Chain Purchase Orders and associated contingency    1.7 Liaise with Product Line Supply Chain Manager to set up SC budget and associated manpower planning    1.8 Act as the main focal point with estimating department to consolidate project supply chain    information for estimation purposes associated to Supply Chain scope    1.9 Develop Supply Chain Execution Plan (SCEP) when required    1.10 Undertake preparatory project execution activities (SC templates, pre-populating tools, contractual specificities etc)    1.11 Be responsible for monitoring of project supply chain budget and for project supply chain reporting        The measure of your effectiveness in this will be:          Supply Chain scope is clearly identified with associated budget and manhours and validated by PMT and Product Line Supply Chain Manager          2. In order that Supply Chain delivery meets project requirements you are to:                  2.1 Lead the project SC team and support them to deliver goods and services allocated to Supply Chain within project constraints, ensuring that the overall quality of purchased equipment and services meets project performance expectations.    2.2 Liaise with PMO for support required to be provided during PO execution to PMO to deliver goods and services allocated to PMO.    2.3 Manage workload and priorities of the project SC team for scope allocated to Supply Chain to ensure compliance with project milestones and liaise with SC Managers to resolve any workload/resourcing issue    2.4 Review and provide input to the project planning to optimize SC activities in line with engineering and construction constraints    2.5 Resolve multi-disciplinary topics with PMT colleagues (Engineering Project Manager, Project Controls Manager, Completion Manager, Delivery/Project Manager, ).    2.6 Get support from SC Managers to ensure SC team members have proper awareness on relevant tools, processes methodology.    2.7 Ensure that all relevant Quality Regulatory Management and HSE, Project and Group Procedures related to supply chain activities are understood and enforced by the project SC team.    2.8 Monitor implementation and ensure compliance Project Procurement Strategy.    2.9 Report to Strategic Sourcing team feedback on applicability of developed strategies or GFA with an ultimate goal of continuous improvement    2.10 Monitor SC risk exposure throughout the project execution phase and implement an appropriate action plan.    2.11 Maintain the Quality and Safety performance of all members of the project SC team          ?       The measure of your effectiveness in this will be:          % of Purchase Orders delivered on time and on budget      SC resource consumption (man-hours) aligned with forecast      External and internal stakeholders satisfaction
column11: Supply chain, Fabrication, Order management, SAP, Project management, Strategic sourcing, Project planning, HSE, RFQ, Continuous improvement

column2: The Process Manager, Contract Mgmt & Sourcing will be responsible for all aspects of?contract and sourcing negotiation and management. Responsible for third party contracts (i.e. vendors), this position requires the ability to establish and maintain excellent working relationships with both internal and external customers to assist in complete understanding of the needs and processes of the service or products provided. Position routinely interacts with high level Business Leaders, Legal staff and various SVB support teams during their collection of information necessary to support the onboarding of a vendor to include the contract creation and negotiation process including sourcing. Regular contract review requires contract compliance monitoring and participation in vendor risk process ensuring contractual agreements meet SVBs needs and protect SVB from risk. Sourcing review requires negotiations with vendors to optimize the cost and enhance savings. The Process Manager is an SME who will lead projects related to various Categories/Sub-Categories. Key Responsibilities: Strategic Sourcing Develop and implement Sourcing Strategies aligned with companys objectives. Identify cost saving opportunities while maintaining or improving product/service quality. Conduct Market research to stay informed about industry trends, pricing and new suppliers. Supplier Management Evaluate and select suppliers based on performance, reliability and cost effectiveness. Negotiate contracts, terms and conditions with suppliers to achieve favorable agreements. Build and maintain strong relationships with key suppliers to ensure a stable and efficient supply chain. ??Risk Management Identify and mitigate potential risks such as economic or logistical issues. Develop contingency plans to address potential disruptions in service delivery. ??Reporting and Analysis Prepare and present reports on key performance indicators, cost savings and supplier performance. Utilize data analysis to drive informed decision making. Conduct cost analysis to identify areas for cost reduction and efficiency improvement. Contract Drafting and Management Understanding of contract lifecycle management Contract negotiations with Suppliers Contract Redlining and reviews Liasoning with Legal as required. Decisions Role will have broad discretion to make decisions with regard to contact negotiations, risk and commercial negotiations working out the most viable solutions for SVB and business stakeholders. Skills Proven experience in strategic sourcing, procurement, or supply chain Ability to draft contracts (SLA's, Termination clauses, etc.)?? Ability to review & negotiate vendor contracts (MSA, NDA, SOW, etc.) Experience in finalizing commercial / legal terms and Category Sourcing Ability to effectively negotiate with internal and external parties and multiple contracts with minimal supervision. Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams Strong knowledge of RFx process Experience in using various sourcing techniques. MS Office suite proficiency is required  WORD, EXCEL etc. Acrobat PDF editing experience Understanding of various contracts including - confidentiality agreements, Masters agreement, Amendments, Addenda, SOW, Assignments, letters of intent, etc. Knowledge of industry trends and regulations Excellent verbal and written communication skills are a must. Ability to consistently adapt to a changing environment.? Efficient and effective ability to manage a program while owning individual projects Competencies List competencies (i.e. initiative, team orientation) that are required to be successful in this role. Initiative, self-starter, team orientation, ability to work independently and an SVB culture carrier. Competencies include, but are not limited to: ?Negotiation Prioritization (Time Management) Communication Program/Project Management Culture (Fit with SVB) Preferred Education and Experience Legal or Paralegal experience a plus Hands on experience in contract and Sourcing Negotiations

column2: Role & responsibilities   Vendor Selection & Collaboration -   Assist in identifying and evaluating potential vendors for the Installation &  Commissioning of microwave radio equipment.   Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment with project  requirements and objectives.   Build and maintain strong relationships with selected vendors, fostering  effective communication and partnerships. column2: Responsibilities: 1.  Developing Procurement Strategy:  Formulate and implement procurement strategies tailored to the unique needs and requirements of renewable energy projects. This involves considering factors such as project timelines, budget constraints, sustainability goals, and regulatory requirements. 2.  Supplier Identification and Qualification:  Identify and evaluate suppliers, vendors, and contractors with expertise in renewable energy technologies and services. Assess supplier capabilities, track records, and certifications to ensure alignment with project specifications and quality standards. 3.  Sourcing Renewable Energy Equipment:  Source renewable energy equipment, components, and materials required for project development, construction, and operation. This includes solar panels, wind turbines, inverters, batteries, balance of system (BOS) components, and other renewable energy infrastructure. 4.  Contract Negotiation and Management:  Negotiate contracts, pricing agreements, and terms of service with suppliers and contractors. Ensure that contracts reflect project requirements, quality standards, delivery schedules, and regulatory compliance. Manage supplier relationships throughout the project lifecycle to ensure contract adherence and resolve issues promptly. 5.  Cost Management and Optimization:  Optimize costs and achieve cost savings through strategic sourcing, volume discounts, and value engineering. Analyze procurement expenditures, identify cost-saving opportunities, and implement cost control measures to maximize project profitability and return on investment (ROI). 6.  Risk Management:  Identify and mitigate procurement risks that may impact project timelines, budgets, and performance. Develop risk management strategies to address supply chain disruptions, price fluctuations, quality issues, and regulatory compliance risks. 7.  Sustainability and Environmental Compliance:  Ensure that procurement activities align with the organization's sustainability goals and environmental commitments. Source materials and equipment with minimal environmental impact, promote energy-efficient technologies, and adhere to relevant environmental regulations and certifications. 8.  Project Collaboration and Coordination:  Collaborate closely with project managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to understand project requirements and timelines. Coordinate procurement activities to support project milestones and ensure timely delivery of materials and equipment to site locations. 9.  Quality Assurance and Control:  Implement quality assurance processes to ensure that procured materials and equipment meet or exceed industry standards and project specifications. Conduct supplier audits, inspections, and quality control checks to verify product quality and performance. 10.  Supplier Diversity and Inclusion:  Promote supplier diversity and inclusion initiatives to engage with a diverse pool of suppliers, including minority-owned, women-owned, and small businesses. Encourage the participation of diverse suppliers in procurement opportunities and foster an inclusive supply chain ecosystem. 11.  Data Analysis and Reporting:  Generate procurement reports, dashboards, and performance metrics to track key performance indicators (KPIs) and monitor procurement performance. Analyze procurement data trends, identify areas for improvement, and make data-driven decisions to optimize procurement processes and outcomes. 12.  Continuous Improvement:  Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance procurement processes, systems, and workflows. Implement best practices, automation tools, and technology solutions to streamline procurement operations, improve efficiency, and reduce cycle times.

column2: Position Summary:  The Team Lead Purchase in the SPM industry is responsible for managing all aspects of procurement and supply chain activities to support the production and delivery of Special Purpose Machines. This role involves developing and implementing procurement strategies, managing vendor relationships, negotiating contracts, and ensuring timely and cost-effective procurement of materials and components. Key Responsibilities: Procurement Strategy:  Develop and implement procurement strategies that align with the company's goals and objectives. Continuously evaluate and optimize procurement processes to improve efficiency and cost-effectiveness. Vendor Management:  Identify, evaluate, and manage supplier relationships to ensure a consistent and reliable supply of materials and components. Negotiate terms and conditions, monitor vendor performance, and resolve any issues that may arise. Cost Control:  Work to minimize procurement costs without compromising quality and delivery schedules. Implement cost-saving initiatives and maintain a competitive edge in the market. Inventory Management:  Oversee inventory levels to ensure an optimal balance between demand and supply. Implement efficient inventory control measures to minimize carrying costs. Sourcing and Selection:  Identify potential suppliers, evaluate their capabilities, and select vendors that meet the company's quality, cost, and reliability standards. Continuously seek new suppliers to diversify the supply chain. Contract Negotiation:  Negotiate and draft contracts with suppliers, outlining terms and conditions, pricing, delivery schedules, quality standards, and other relevant terms. Ensure compliance with contractual agreements. Quality Assurance:  Collaborate with the quality control team to ensure that procured materials meet the required quality standards. Address any quality issues and implement corrective actions. Compliance:  Ensure compliance with all relevant regulations, laws, and industry standards in the procurement process. Stay updated on any changes in regulations and adapt procurement practices accordingly. Budget Management:  Develop and manage the procurement budget, ensuring that all procurement activities are conducted within budgetary constraints. Team Leadership:  Lead and mentor the procurement team, providing guidance, support, and training to enhance their skills and performance. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Mechanical, supply chain management, or a related field.  Proven experience in procurement, preferably in the SPM or manufacturing industry. Strong negotiation and contract management skills. In-depth knowledge of supply chain management, procurement best practices, and industry trends. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities. Proficiency in using procurement and supply chain management software. Experience in Automation industry is highly preferrable

Derive Procurement strategies on the service requirements or negotiate these requirements independently with the suppliers for assigned projects in accordance with Business and BU- wide Procurement strategies and ensure their implementation (in particular pooling or utilization of master contracts), as well as identify solution approaches and improvement potentials to ensure alignment with the strategic         Procurement targets as well as overall business strategies.         Lead contractual and price negotiations and/or support the specialist buyers responsible for particular material fields (in particular those not covered by any Commodity Management) to secure project targets with optimum conditions e.g. Total Cost of         Ownership (ToCO) for service-relevant parts. Clarify internal indicators for project controlling and compile all relevant information to submit qualified reports (e.g. for the project team, Procurement management).         Proactively ensure resource availability, status, transparency and alerting of deviations. Sensitize cross-functional partners for Procurement related practices processes and metrics. column2: Position: Senior Manager  Procurement and Logistics, Energy For Health (full time, 6 months??probation period) Years of Experience:  10 to 12 years Location:  SELCO Foundation, Bengaluru Starting date:  Immediately About SELCO Foundation: SELCO Foundation is an open source, not for prot organization that engages in eld-based R&D and ecosystem building for deployment of clean energy solutions that alleviate poverty in tribal, rural and urban poor areas. The organization works in collaboration with practitioners in the social sector, energy entrepreneurs, NGOs from various developmental sectors and educational institutions to link the benets of sustainable energy to poverty eradication. The organization works across verticals such as energy access, health, livelihoods with practitioners in the social sector, energy entrepreneurs and partners from various developmental sectors. You can nd more information about SELCO Foundation on our  organization website. Background on SELCO's Energy For Health progra The goal of this program is to strengthen delivery of healthcare for over 170 million people by reliably and sustainably powering 25,000 public health facilities in remote, rural, climate and socio- economically vulnerable regions across 12 states in India by 2026. Healthcare today, without considering the potential services to the uncatered populations in the world, is the 5th most polluting industry. The proposed program can help improve the quality of health services in a decentralized manner, while also making it a less carbon intensive sector. This program can prove to be the low hanging fruit for achieving SDG13 and SDG3 via SDG7. We believe that provision of 100% renewable energy and green building infrastructure for healthcare facilities, will democratize the much-needed health services in the remote regions within India and account for future pandemic preparedness. The Role: SELCO Foundation is looking for a highly motivated individual who is passionate about working in the sustainable energy sector. The Senior Manager ??Procurement and Logistics is expected to ensure entire procurement cycle for the energy for health program and support the program team with its hardware and services procurement. He/she should be willing to build and mentor a lean team and find ways to increase the quality of output, and implement best practices across all levels. Key responsibilities for the position: Responsible for procurement of goods and services for the entire Energy for Health Program and ensure smooth functioning of procurement dept and its entire cycle. Based on the program plan for the year, create a procurement strategy for all project locations and be able to manage procurement for execution of the programs pan India. Responsible to build a procurement strategy which will include mapping of technology manufacturers to deployers and build strategic relationships and trust for quick and smooth deployments Responsible for creating a sector wise database of large-scale suppliers/vendors/service providers in all the geographies that we work in and able to negotiate best rates and timelines. Responsible for writing and publishing tenders, processing tender applications, working on agreements and work order etc. Responsible for capturing procurement learnings, analyze costs and compare and be able to derive at best practices and benchmarks Responsible for complete documentation and filing of all procurement and make it audit ready Who can apply: Minimum 10 to12+ years of work experience in relevant eld with track record of 100+ Crore worth procurement of goods and services Ability to mentor and manage the procurement team and collaborate with other teams in the organization Strong skill sets to plan meticulously and rigorously follow up on a day-to-day basis. Ability to evaluate quality of solar components, electrical components, health equipment etc Strong negotiation skills with added language skills of English, Hindi and Kannada preferred Willingness to travel if required.

column2: This position is accountable for all aspects of the purchasing, raw materials, and supply chain activities for Pigments.    He/she will manage all aspects of supply chain operations to ensure that AOP objectives are met and exceeded, and conduct all responsibilities in compliance with policy. Negotiate resolution of disputes, changes in scope and material price changes.     Provide major raw material market trends to management every week.     Communicate plans and roll-out new supplier programs to fully implement procurement strategies.     Manage ongoing supplier relationships.     Single point of contact for coordinating with accounts department for payment of vendors.     Comply with all established departmental objectives with regard to supplier evaluations, sustainability initiatives, supplier visit reports, cost reduction reporting, etc. using the appropriate tools.     Forecast price and market trends to identify changes of balance in buyer-supplier power.     Streamlining systems and procedures for effective inventory control for ensuring ready availability of materials to meet production targets.     Involve in releasing debit note to the supplier for rejected damage items.     Assisting SCM , in negotiating and contracting requirement on a timely manner.     Would be responsible for dispatch, Factory coordination.     Solid market knowledge and ability to quickly become recognized internally and externally as knowledgeable in the supply markets for inorganic, organic and aromatic chemicals.     Proven ability to develop and deliver persuasive argumentation in pricing and contract negotiations is essential.     The ability to work professionally and effectively with Senior Managers in direct support of their objectives. column2: Skill required:Procurement Operations - Procurement Practices  Designation:Associate Manager  Qualifications:Any Graduation  Years of Experience:10 to 14 years Language - Ability:English - Advanced  What would you do? "Accenture Procurement BPO Services provides a complete source-to-pay offering focused on driving real business outcomes. Our Sourcing and Category Management model, procure-to-pay utility and global delivery network help our clients reduce their cost of acquiring goods and services, maximize vendor performance and improve sourcing and procurement efficiency. The Contractor Exchange (CX) is Procurement BPO's contractor management service. Supported by the IQNavigator vendor management system, the CX offers a fully managed contractor and temporary labor procurement and management solution to Accenture The External Talent (ET) Sourcing & Contracting Category Lead (Contractor Proc) India leads the strategy, execution, and continuous improvement associated with the end to end process for the contract labor category while leading the Demand and Supply sides associated with supporting Accenture's business strategies. The External Talent (ET) Sourcing & Contracting Category Lead (Contractor Proc) India will manage a team of up to 6-8 plus individuals focused on  The sourcing & category mgmt. of Contract Labor category.  Benchmarking and negotiation of contractor costs  On-boarding and management of suppliers including recruitment agencies / brokers and IT Companies / consultancies The External Talent (ET) Sourcing & Contracting Category Lead (Contractor Proc) will have responsibilities of building and maintaining strong business relationships with key internal stakeholders, across India Market (including all entities of Accenture) and promote use of Cx services. " What are we looking for? " Bachelors Degree and additional Business Related Degree  Relevant Professional Qualification, e.g. MBA, Chartered Institute of Purchasing & Supply or local equivalent Personality Traits Required: The following traits are essential: ?Ability to work comfortably with all levels of the organization ?Strong written and oral communication skills ?Strong relationship management skills and a proactive customer-focused approach with enthusiasm to create change ?Ability to work in a fast-paced team environment and minimum guidance ?Team player ?Self-starter, demonstrating initiative and confidence ?Flexible ?Problem-solving/analytical skills ?Thorough/detailed approach to work ?Excellent negotiation, influence, mediation & conflict management skills ?Excellent business acumen and industry acumen Specific 15+ years' experience in Procurement/Recruitment preferably in IT or Consulting company to include: oRecruitment / contractor sourcing experience in the IT/Consulting industry oGood understanding of Procurement processes oDemonstrated ability to understand client requirements and executing Procurement strategies to meet those requirements. oMust have good understanding of relevant skillsets/industry as required by client oVendor / Supplier Management  Knowledge of the Subcontractor category and marketplace, including one or more of the following areas: oIT Contractors oTemporary Labour oConsultancy Services  Management experience, including team management / virtual teams  Experience in defining and implementing service levels, and delivering services within agreed SLA's  Attention to detail, with the ability to quickly analyze data, identify trends and inaccuracies, and summarize information for communication to business stakeholders  Initiative, ability to motivate, with positive and customer focused attitude  Experience of building senior-level relationships within client & supplier organizations  Strong analytical, written and oral communication skills" Roles and Responsibilities: " Develop the country category strategy for managing contract labor spend (to be approved by Global Category Director) to improve quality and reduce overall cost of sub/contractor services through lower cost capabilities and sources of supply and work with other leads to execute same.  Work with Senior Executive leadership, Alliance Services, Contract Management, and Operations to ensure category strategy aligns with the business strategy.  Lead a team towards increased adoption, compliance, utilization, operational efficiency and procurement savings by increasing contractor Spend Under Management.  Drive margin improvements across Accenture's engagements where sub/contractor services are a key component of the service delivery model.  Responsible for being on point for local internal External Talent (ET) related audit activities and collaborating with P+ risk/V&A/360 teams to drive alignment on shared priorities and objectives.  Leverage the standard Sourcing and Category Management methodology to achieve significant value in strategy definition, sourcing, supplier selection, and negotiation/contracting.  Manage suppliers towards increased performance by measuring outcomes, auditing to contract compliance, and fostering business development opportunities  Drive a common set of technologies and processes aligned to increased process efficiency, spend visibility, and supplier performance  Work with Global Category Director to lead Accenture towards a common sub/contractor purchasing framework and capability, defining and operating the ongoing procurement operating model for the category  Work closely with Cx Sourcing Leads to develop strategies and manage (create, maintain, and prioritize) sourcing pipeline to ensure maximum value is attained. People Management  Monitor & manage delivery of value by team & provide focus, assignments, motivation, support, proactive feedback & coaching to team members.  Provide Contract Labor Sourcing & Category Management support & assistance to the whole team and ensure the tasks given are prioritized according to greatest business needs.  Manage & develop team. Set team goals & objectives. Analyze performance/skill gaps."

column2: Purchasing Manager        (      Job Number:          HOT0AD61    )          Work Locations      :          Hilton Hyderabad Genome Valley Resort and Spa            Sy. 19,  Turkapally,  Medchal   Malkaigiri District,  Karimnagar   Hyderabad Highway                    Shamirpet Mandal        500078                    A Purchasing Manager will work with suppliers to negotiate contracts,  purchase required goods,  and keep accurate records of transactions,  trends,  and performance with vendors.         What will I be doing?          As Purchasing Manager,  you will work with suppliers to negotiate contracts,  purchase required goods,  and keep accurate records of transactions,  trends,  and performance with vendors.  Specifically,  you will be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standards:      Obtain competitive quotations for hotel requirements and ensure that the best product is sourced and purchased,  using Group Nominated suppliers where applicable.     Ensure locally Nominated supplier information is kept current.     Manage the database of active local contracts with suppliers.     Ensure Purchasing Manual is current.     Adhere to quality procedures and standards and oversee purchasing administration such that all Hilton policies and standards are upheld.     Work with the Finance Manager / Director to draft the annual budget.     Maintain a record of commitments for all budgets and ensure that the relevant senior managers are constantly informed of updates.     Ensure a comprehensive system for allocating and reconciling purchase orders.     Manage relationships with hotel suppliers and report on their performance.     Manage employee relations,  recruiting Team Members as required,  and follow the appraisal procedures for Team Members    Supervise the operation of the stores,  uphold company health and safety,  quality assurance and control procedures,  make improvements to the level of control,  compile accurate stock records,  and maintain proper records of requisition and replenishment transactions.     Monitor all areas of purchasing including contracts,  leases and nominations.     Prepare the month end accounts reports in an accurate and timely manner.     Execute on tasks/requests as instructed by the Hotel Management.                         What are we looking for?          A Purchasing Manager serving Hilton brands is always working on behalf of our Guests and working with other Team Members.  To successfully fill this role,  you should maintain the attitude,  behaviours,  skills,  and values that follow:      Previous experience in purchasing/procurement    Strong financial knowledge and ability to work with budgets.     Computer literate,  with good Microsoft Excel skills    Good time management and organisation skills    Accountable and resilient    Ability to work under pressure at all times.       It would be advantageous in this position for you to demonstrate the following capabilities and distinctions:      Previous experience within the hotel/leisure sector    Previous experience in a similar role    Relevant degree,  in Finance/Accounting or related business discipline,  from an academic institution            What will it be like to work for Hilton?          Hilton is the leading global hospitality company,  spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels.  For nearly a century,  Hilton has offered business and leisure travelers the finest in accommodations,  service,  amenities and value.  Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its  global brands .   Our vision  to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality  unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day.   And,  our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all!                                Job      :        Supply Management,  Procurement,  Purchasing,  and Receiving          Schedule      :        Full-time

column2: As the Delivery Manager for Procurement Outsourcing Services at EmpoweringCPO, you will take on a leadership role overseeing the entire project lifecycle. This position requires a seasoned professional with expertise in procurement processes, team management, client engagement, and proficiency in SAP Hana and Jaggaer e-procurement tools. As a Delivery Manager for Procurement Support function, you should possess a deep understanding of procurement practices, excellent communication skills, and the ability to build and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders. You will be responsible for ensuring the timely, effective and efficient provision of support services that are essential for adequate operation of the procurement division. Key Responsibilities: Project Leadership: Provide strategic direction and leadership throughout the delivery phase of procurement outsourcing service. Ensure successful execution and management of service deliverables within established timelines and resource constraints. Team Management: Lead and motivate a diverse team, including procurement coordinators, sourcing specialists, and support staff. Conduct regular team meetings, provide guidance, and facilitate professional development. Client Engagement: Act as the primary point of contact for the client, fostering a strong relationship. Collaborate with the client to understand their requirements, expectations, and strategic objectives. SLA Management: Establish and monitor Service Level Agreements (SLAs) to ensure quality, accuracy, and timeliness of deliverables. Implement performance metrics and continuous improvement initiatives. Training and Development: Design and implement training programs for team members on procurement processes, tools, and best practices. Conduct regular training sessions to enhance the team's skills and capabilities. Technical Proficiency: Demonstrate proficiency in SAP Hana and Jaggaer e-procurement tools. Reporting and Analytics: Develop and present regular reports to both internal stakeholders and the client. Utilize data analytics to identify areas for improvement and implement data-driven decision-making. Qualifications: Proven experience in delivery management within the procurement or outsourcing domain. Strong understanding of procurement processes, including low-value transactional activities. Demonstrated experience in client relationship management and satisfaction. Proficiency in SAP Hana and Jaggaer eprocurement tools. Key Competencies: Excellent leadership and interpersonal skills. Strong organizational and time management abilities. Problem-solving mindset with a focus on continuous improvement. Effective communication and negotiation skills. Education: Bachelor's degree in Business, Supply Chain Management, or a related field.  Working Schedule Flexibility: Applicant should be willing to work on non-standard working hours and days as per the client's calendar, the working days can be from Sunday to Thursday, and public holidays can be different compared to what they are for India. On a normal day, tentative working hours can be from 11 AM to 8 PM IST. This role is pivotal in ensuring the success of the Procurement Outsourcing project, requiring a dynamic leader who can effectively manage teams, engage with clients, and drive results in alignment with SLAs and industry best practices.

column2: Overview: The Assistant Manager- Service Purchase is responsible for overseeing the procurement of services essential to the operations of the organization. They work closely with various departments to understand their service needs, identify potential service providers, negotiate contracts, and ensure that services are delivered in a timely and cost-effective manner. The Assistant Manager- Service purchase also monitors supplier performance, resolves any issues that may arise, and continuously seeks opportunities to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the procurement process.   Location:  Mahape  Role & responsibilities  :   1.  Service Needs Assessment:  Collaborate with department heads and key stakeholders to       identify the service requirements of the organization. 2.  Supplier Identification and Evaluation:  Research and evaluate potential service providers based on factors such as quality, cost, reliability, and compliance with organizational requirements. 3.  Negotiation and Contracting:  Negotiate terms and conditions with selected service providers      to secure favorable contracts that meet the organization's needs while minimizing costs and      risks. 4.  Vendor Management:   Lead the Vendor Management services i.e. selecting vendors,      negotiating contracts, controlling costs, reducing vendor-related risks, and ensuring timely      service delivery. 5.  Supplier Relationship Management:  Build and maintain strong relationships with service      providers to ensure smooth communication, address any issues or concerns, and promote a      collaborative partnership. 6.  Contract Management:  Manage the lifecycle of service contracts, including drafting      agreements, tracking contract expiration dates, and renewing or renegotiating contracts as       needed. 7.  Cost Management:  Develop and implement strategies to optimize service procurement costs      while maintaining quality and reliability. 8.  Process Improvement:  Continuously evaluate and improve the procurement process to     enhance efficiency, reduce lead times, and streamline operations. Preferred candidate profile  :  1. Candidate must have at least 3 to 8 years of proven experience in procurement or purchasing,       preferably in a service-oriented environment like Transport Services, AMC Services, Software       Services, Insurance Services, Quality Services 2. Strong negotiation skills and ability to build productive relationships with suppliers and internal       stakeholders. 3. Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities. 4. Knowledge of relevant regulations and best practices in procurement and contract      management. 5. Effective communication and interpersonal skills.   Interested candidates kindly share their resumes on   talead@esconelevators.com   Perks and benefits  :   6 Days Working (3rd Saturday Off) , PF & Mediclaim

column2: Your Role and Responsibilities The Buy@IBM Center of Excellence team is a made up of several different squads including the handsfree squad, the procurement administration squad, and the sourcing RFx squad to name a few. These squads support the procurement sourcing buyer squads in system administration, handsfree buy channel configuration including catalogs, and supporting complex RFx events. The team is engaged in consulting with the buyer squads on implementing best practices, reducing workload, and optimize the available procurement applications for business needs.  The team works well and shares responsibilities across the squad to deliver on SLAs to IBM Procurement. The team is always improving and has a continuous growth mindset. The team members are cross trained in multiple areas to support fluctuating business needs. The squads also support new country deployments on Buy@IBM as well as Softlayer deployment needs. The team interlocks with Procurement One Place, CIO Level 2, and the supplier enablement team to deliver seamlessly to the clients. Procurement transformation product owners are consulted and provide direction and education on new and existing tool capabilities within the procurement applications. IBM COE team works with them to identify business needs and solution the procurement requests as needed in areas of function as well as technical support. For the Japan wave 10 rollout, we are looking to initially hire someone with Level 1 or Level 2 Japanese language skills who can help with communication with IBMs suppliers to set up handsfree/no touch purchase order processing. The communication will require both verbal and written language skills in a business formal setting. The technical skills listed below will be more secondary initially with the candidate able to move into those skills in more depth over the next 2 months. Required Technical and Professional Expertise Ability to learn new applications and business processes Ability to transfer business needs into application administration changes to support procurement goals of workload reduction and better user experience Good communication skills- both written and spoken in Japanese AND English Minimum of Level N2 Japanese certification required Skills to take ownership and drive open items to closure Growth mindset Customer success mindset Experience utilizing procurement applications across multiple domains including but not limited to CAAPS, SAP and Buy@IBM Understanding of IBM procurement business processes Knowledge of the procurement BlueBook  Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise Experience using CDA, CSA, Bond, GCF, etc would be ideal Procurement sourcing experience

You will be an integral part of the team supporting strategic and operational aspects of managing the customer relationships with our vendors. You will interface internally with leaders of our Vendor Services teams and product organizations and will be responsible for all aspects of the vendor s   business.   What you can expect to do-      Convert leads into vendors by closing negotiations with vendors assisting vendors in   onboarding and training on seller systems     Review performance with vendors to take corrective actions and help vendors increase     their business by providing directions to improve inputs metrics     Working along with the program leaders to drive product capabilities adoption     Act as a PoC for the vendor to address their concerns     Build strong communication channels at all levels, set proper expectations, provide clear status communications, and manage towards a growth plan for the vendors     Perform deep dive analysis on the handled issues for the vendors and act on recommendations and action plans based on data to improve vendor experience     Success will be measured by the performance on input metrics and impact of vendors on creating a great customer experience for buying consumers.       In addition to being a support to grooming vendors to become self-sufficient on the platform, the individual is expected to take on larger responsibilities such as initiating and owning process improvement projects, participating actively in stakeholder calls/meetings etc   What will you need -      Graduate or a post graduate degree in business management or a related field.     3+ years of experience in retail/FMCG/e-commerce industry     Proficiency in Excel with proven analytic skills negotiation skills     Ability to think and react in a high-energy, fast-paced environment     Excellent written and oral communication skills

column2: Strategic Procurement Leadership - To develop and implement strategic procurement plans aligned with the company's objectives and project requirements. - To lead a procurement team in sourcing materials, equipment, and services necessary for civil engineering and infrastructure projects. - To establish and maintain relationships with key suppliers and vendors to ensure timely and cost-effective procurement of quality materials and services. - To drive initiatives to optimize procurement processes, improve efficiency, and achieve cost savings without compromising quality or project timelines. Project Collaboration - To collaborate closely with project managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to understand project requirements and develop procurement strategies accordingly. - To provide procurement expertise and support throughout the project lifecycle, from planning and budgeting to execution and closeout. - To ensure procurement activities are aligned with project schedules, budgets, and quality standards, and adjust plans as necessary to meet changing project needs. Vendor/Supplier Management - To evaluate and select suppliers based on criteria such as quality, cost, reliability, and compliance with regulatory standards. - To negotiate contracts and agreements with suppliers to obtain favourable terms, pricing, and delivery schedules. - To monitor supplier performance and address any issues or concerns promptly to ensure continuous improvement and adherence to contract terms. Risk Management and Compliance - To identify and mitigate procurement-related risks, including supply chain disruptions, quality issues, and cost overruns. - To ensure compliance with company policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements in all procurement activities, including contract management and vendor due diligence. - To stay informed about industry trends, market conditions, and regulatory changes affecting procurement practices in the civil engineering and infrastructure sectors. Budgeting and Reporting - To develop and manage procurement budgets for civil engineering projects, tracking spending and identifying opportunities for cost reduction. - To prepare regular reports on procurement activities, including budget variance analysis, supplier performance metrics, and savings achieved. - To present procurement plans, progress updates, and recommendations to senior management and project stakeholders as needed. Qualifications & Expertise   1. The person Must be of man of manners with high philosophy   of not to indulge in Corporate Kleptocracy Shall be in the age group of 35 to 50 only Person with good physic and no chronic and   serious health issues & ailments Shall be a go getter and at the same time should   not over throw everything personally and shoot-up his HBP levels   2. Education Must be an Engineer with Civil, Mechanical   streams as major PGDM or MBA from a reputed business school    desired but not must Professional certification for purchase and/or   supply chain management such as CPSM or CSCP is desired but not bust   3. Experience Should have at least 15 to 20 years of post   qualification experience Must have been a Manager for at least 5 to 8   years Experience in Civil Construction and Infrastructure   Companies is must   4. Expertise Must have worked and/or familiar to Government   Projects ??Tendering process etc. Should have worked in tight schedule projects   with cost conservancy and JIT supplies  Must have ability to build Vendor Resource with   flair and work with them freely Could quickly adept to the conservative   purchasing norms and ensure professional deliveries within given budget Strong leadership and management skills, with   the ability to motivate and develop a team of procurement professionals Excellent negotiation, communication, and   interpersonal skills, with the ability to build and maintain relationships   with internal and external stakeholders. In-depth knowledge of procurement best   practices, contract management, and supply chain management principles. Familiarity with relevant regulations and   standards governing procurement in the civil engineering and infrastructure   sectors.   5. Addl Skills Proficient in Computers ??MS Office Could able to work in Procurement software   6. Compensation Would commensurate to the qualification &   experience Best in the Industry   7. Apply to hr@keyem.in   8. Company Visit www.keyem.in

column1: Job opening For the Position of Purchase Manager
column2: Job Description: Analysing the request from the site after scrutinizing, If the requisition has all the details / specifications the enquiry is floated immediately to our various registered vendors or to new vendors by email.? Emphasis to be made on a detailed quote submitted by all the vendors i.e. Make, Specification, Unit Rate, timeline, payment terms, guarantee / warranty, taxes etc., this help us to compare the quotes for the products to be procured.? A minimum of three or more quotes to be obtained and thereafter negotiations are done with various vendors to get the highest quality goods and services at the lowest possible cost.? A revised quote to be obtained from the vendors / suppliers and a comparative statement is made with detailed specifications.? Preparation of comparative statement to analyse the cost of the needed product.? Close working with the department who have requisitioned and rope in technical personnel as and when required when deciding on purchases.? Discussion with Team buying before finalizing / submitting an order discussion on the product, pricing, reliability and ability to supply and complete the work, timelines, quality of purchased goods with the technical team or with the supervisor who supervises the job.? Collecting sample of the product required, or alternatively request the concerned supervisor / engineer to collect the sample or verify the material proposed to be procured. Only upon confirmation from the concerned site engineer / supervisor finalization or release of purchase order / work order is commenced. Preparation of Comparative statement with all supporting documents for approval. Preparing the PO / WO as per our terms & conditions, agreed rates with the finalized vendor. Follow-up with Vendors in co-ordination with Site for supply of materials / completion of works as per our agreed schedule mentioned in the order. Other job responsibilities  Advance / Bills / Payment follow-ups of Vendors, Reconciliation of Vendor payments / Bills and other works as per Dept. Head / Management.
column11: Purchase Operations, Purchase Management, Contract Management, Procurement Management, Purchase Vendor Development

column2: We are seeking an experienced Commercial Specialist to join WiseEnergy India s Commercial Team to manage revenues, contracts, insurance and provide to regulatory and statutory compliance management for solar energy assets in India and overtime, internationally.          KEY RESPONSIBILITIES          This will be an integral role in the WiseEnergy India (WEI) team:, including:                  Management of energy sales (Power Purchase Agreements) with off-takers, interconnection agreements with transmission distribution companies, coordination with SLDC for forecasting scheduling obligations.                  Billing of energy and other attributes, collection management and creation of monthly sales reports.                  Internal coordination with technical, finance and debt management team and external liaison with consultants and suppliers as required.                  Providing asset management recommendations to clients.                  Active monitoring of changes in the regulations of the electricity market in the regions where projects are located.                  Coordination and liaison with the officials of government and regulatory bodies representing renewable energy market including DISCOMS, TSERC, KERC, TSSLDC, KPTCL, official organizations and offices.                  Management of forecasting and scheduling obligations directly or through consultants, forecasting accuracy monitoring, penalties for deviations, coordination of improvement implementations                  Ensure compliance with obligations and reports to official bodies in every region where projects are located.                  Ensure compliance with environmental, social, governance (ESG) and community relations obligations and requirements.                  Management of land lease agreements including payments as per the local regulations.                  Contract management ie, renewals, tendering, issuing notices, obligations, etc related to individual solar farm companies.                  Insurance management including renewals, developing relationships with insurance brokers and claims management.                  Development and population of relevant information on to the company s in-house asset management platform (AMP),                  Management of 3-4 local contractors providing part-time assistance on site.              Ad hoc domestic in India, as required.              SKILLS COMPETENCIES          To be successful in this role, you will demonstrate:                    Time management prioritization skills        - things can get a little hectic, so the ability to effectively manage yourself and your workload is critical.                    Excellent interpersonal and communication skills in English and basic knowledge of Kannada Telugu        -      you must be able to organize your thoughts in a way that others find clear and compelling. You will be expected to together well-written, grammatically correct emails and other communications. When communicating verbally - whether over the phone, on video calls, in person or in meetings - you will need to be articulate, warm, and engaging.                    Flexibility        - being an effective team player means being flexible in your approach and open to getting involved with new things, even if they are not spelled out in your job description.                    Intellectual Curiosity        -      Commercial management is a broad and nuanced field, and we are looking for someone who is truly interested in our profession and has the intellectual curiosity to delve deep into topics and bring fresh ideas to the team.                    IT Literacy        - you need to be comfortable with IT systems and working with data (you should have at least intermediate-level excel)                    Delivery focus        - it may sound obvious, but the ability to proactively churn through work at pace and deliver quality outputs really matters.                    Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills                      Passion for our mission        to generate a more sustainable future by leading the transition to clean energy.                Our values:        be a leader, build trust, be responsible, be innovative and bring your alpha .                  EXPERIENCE QUALIFICATIONS                  Engineering Graduate                  8 to 10 plus years experience              The right to work in India.

column2: You will be responsible for the procurement activities in our HVDC tenders.         You will have a key role interacting with HVDC stakeholders in tender, i.e. engineering, R&D,service, tender management, project management, general management levels at HVDC and the global SCM organization.         You will be on the driving seat for any needs or issues related to supply chain, engaging other departments (engineering, documentation, finance, etc.) to receive the input needed for your Tender.         Perform cost calculation on the material, resources, and other costs related to SCM scope.         Provide feedback to tender team related to time schedule, terms & conditions, payment milestones, customer requirements, perform risk assessment from SCM perspective.         Connect with SCM category managers and the suppliers, for at least but not limited to, Request for Quotation (RFQ), negotiation, discussing special customer requirements.         Contribute to strategic work, lessons learned, and continuous improvement.         Tender Management: Adhere to internal processes with flexibility to adapt solutions to project specifics.          Attend Project Kick-off Meeting and Tender Team Meetings as SCM representative.          Obtain and check for completeness and correctness of all relevant Tender information, to comply with both internal processes and Client requirements         Communicate with relevant Engineering Teams for clarification of scope and technical issues, Communicate with Sales Department for clarification of commercial issues         Maintain understanding of the Tender s technical evolution including Bill of Quantities (BOQ).         Analyze customer specifications and internal engineering documentation with regard to SCM Scope, Prepares all relevant Tender-Project specific Documentation as per customer / Internal requirements, seeks approval as per Approval-Process and submits the same together with the approved Cost Calculation, Participate in handover of successful Tenders to Project Execution.          Active support in market development in collaboration with Category Team.         ?To ensures compliance with rules and regulations within the team. To identify customer needs, price analysis, offer and negotiate in order to secure order.         Communication: Establishes clear and transparent communication between Supplier and Tender team.         Contributes to vendor list management by providing Supplier Performance data. Ensure that our suppliers comply with the laws, regulations, standards, certificates and directives that Hitachi Energy requires from their suppliers.         Establishes clear and transparent communication internally, externally, and between different Divisions, Business Units and Functions and supports the implementation of PL activities and initiatives in the Region/Country through this clear communication.         Living Hitachi Energy core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business.               Your Background :           Have an academic degree in a relevant field: BE (Electrical), Supply Chain Management or equivalent experience. You are a team player with strong communicative and collaborative skills, and you are comfortable with thinking outside of the box. column2: Key Purpose of the Job         This is a key position that requires excellent negotiation skills, and the ability to meet procurement deadlines through proper coordination internally with the commercial department, and externally for the suppliers and contractors. To ensure that material is delivered at right time, right quality and at best prices.     Working Experience in managerial monitoring role.     Working Knowledge of ERP Software environment.     Responsible for planning, procurement, vendor development, inventory control, store management at various project sites.     Evaluating rate/quotation, and negotiation with suppliers for finalizing the rate and ensuring special discounts made available along with favourable terms and conditions.     Specialist in demand supply analysis, purchasing analysis, price/rate analysis, material reconciliation analysis, physical manual stock analysis, cost control analysis.     Procurement at lowest possible costs as per the BOQ. Monitor and allot part numbering of materials procured within the organization. Identification of new products/ discontinue of the products.     Maintain the rate list of the products/materials from the vendors and carry out regular updates. column2: Skills Set required/Job Profile :           Stock & inventory management.          Monthly inventory & stock taking.          Dispatch Knowledge          Communication with Customer          Co ordination with Production Dept for Dispatch.          Overall planning.          Dispatcher Job Responsibilities:         Delivers items to customers by verifying orders.         Inventories stock.         Arranges transportation.         Organizes item order by editing for price, promotions, and weight compliance.         Arranges shipments by checking stock to determine inventory levels, anticipating delivery requirements, and placing/expediting orders.         Ships items by examining items, destination, route, rate, and delivery time; ordering carriers.         Verifies items shipped by matching bills of lading, reconciling quantities, and noting discrepancies. Protects the organization s reputation by keeping pricing, promotion, purchase order, and credit-limit information confidential.

column2: We are looking for a Purchase Engineer/Manager, whose responsibilities will include developing purchasing strategies, maintaining positive relationships with suppliers, coordinating with internal teams regarding their procurement/supply needs, and overseeing the purchasing team in their day-to-day activities.
