column2: Assistant Purchase Managers provide support to the procurement or purchasing department within an organization      They assist in managing the procurement process, sourcing suppliers, and ensuring the timely acquisition of goods and services needed by the company      Here are the key responsibilities of an Assistant Purchase Manager:Sourcing Suppliers: Assistant Purchase Managers help identify and evaluate potential suppliers or vendors      They research and compare suppliers based on factors such as price, quality, delivery times, and terms of service      They may also negotiate contracts and establish relationships with suppliers      Purchase Order Processing: They assist in generating purchase orders based on approved requisitions or orders from internal stakeholders      They ensure accuracy and completeness of purchase orders, including the item specifications, quantities, delivery dates, and pricing information      Inventory Management: Assistant Purchase Managers monitor inventory levels and collaborate with relevant departments to determine stock requirements      They maintain accurate records of stock levels, track inventory movement, and coordinate with suppliers to ensure timely replenishment      Supplier Relationship Management: They work closely with suppliers, maintaining effective communication channels and addressing any issues or concerns that may arise      They may participate in supplier performance evaluations, quality audits, and contract negotiations to ensure optimal supplier performance      Price and Contract Negotiation: Assistant Purchase Managers assist in negotiating pricing, terms, and contracts with suppliers to secure favorable agreements for the organization      They may collaborate with senior purchasing managers or procurement officers during negotiations      Vendor Evaluation and Qualification: They assist in evaluating potential suppliers and conducting due diligence to assess their capabilities, financial stability, reputation, and compliance with industry regulations      They may also maintain a vendor database with relevant information for future reference      Purchase Requisition Processing: They review and process purchase requisitions from different departments, ensuring they comply with company policies and procedures      They may liaise with requestors to gather additional information and clarify requirements, if necessary      Documentation and Reporting: Assistant Purchase Managers maintain accurate records of procurement activities, such as purchase orders, invoices, contracts, and correspondence with suppliers      They generate reports on procurement performance, supplier evaluations, and cost savings for management review      Compliance and Ethics: They adhere to legal and ethical procurement practices, including compliance with applicable laws, regulations, and company policies      They may assist in ensuring supplier compliance with environmental, social, and governance (ESG) standards      Continuous Improvement: Assistant Purchase Managers contribute to the improvement of procurement processes and systems by identifying areas for optimization, cost reduction, and efficiency enhancement      They may propose and implement process improvements to streamline procurement operations      Strong analytical skills, attention to detail, negotiation abilities, and knowledge of procurement processes are essential for success as an Assistant Purchase Manager      Additionally, proficiency in using procurement software or enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems is often required to manage purchasing activities effectively

column2: Job Description: We  are seeking a dynamic and experienced individual to join our team as  Assistant Manager/Manager for Packing Materials Purchase & Packaging  Development. In this role, you will lead our packing materials  procurement efforts and drive packaging innovation initiatives to  enhance product protection, sustainability, and brand differentiation. Key Responsibilities: -  Develop and execute strategic plans for sourcing packing materials,  including Bags, Containers, Pails corrugated boxes, labels, films, and  other packaging components, to ensure cost-effectiveness, quality, and  availability. -  Lead supplier selection processes, negotiate contracts, and manage  supplier relationships to secure favorable terms, pricing, and service  levels for packaging materials. -  Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product development,  marketing, and operations, to understand packaging requirements and  align procurement strategies with business objectives. -  Drive packaging innovation and sustainability initiatives by  researching emerging trends, materials, and technologies, and  implementing best practices to minimize environmental impact and enhance  brand reputation. -  Oversee packaging development projects from concept to  commercialization, working closely with internal stakeholders and  external partners to ensure packaging solutions meet functional,  aesthetic, and regulatory requirements. -  Conduct regular performance evaluations of suppliers, monitor key  performance indicators (KPIs), and implement corrective actions as  needed to maintain high standards of quality and service. -  Manage packaging inventory levels and optimize inventory turnover to  minimize carrying costs while ensuring continuity of supply. -  Stay abreast of industry developments, regulatory changes, and market  trends related to packaging materials and recommend strategies to adapt  to evolving requirements. Qualifications: -  Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Supply Chain Management,  Packaging Engineering, or a related field; Master's degree preferred. -  Minimum 6 years of experience in procurement, supplier management, and  packaging development, preferably in a manufacturing or consumer goods  industry. -  Strong understanding of packaging materials, processes, and  technologies, including knowledge of sustainable packaging practices and  circular economy principles. - Proven track record of negotiating contracts, managing supplier relationships, and driving cost savings initiatives. -  Excellent project management skills with the ability to prioritize  tasks, manage timelines, and lead cross-functional teams to deliver  results. - Proficiency in using procurement software and tools for supplier management and data analysis. -  Strong communication, interpersonal, and leadership skills with the  ability to influence and collaborate effectively at all organizational  levels.

column2: Role & responsibilities     The  Procurement Manager  (PM) will be responsible for the following activities:  Responsible for identifying potential villages in the catchment area, on boarding new villages, identification of Sanchalikas in selected villages & operationalisation of  Village Poultry Farmer Engagement Centre (VPFEC)  in the catchment area. S/he will be responsible for mobilization of shareholder farmers and regular engagement with them.  S/he needs to ensure that the members farmers build poultry sheads as per the guidelines laid down in the company  before receiving the chicks S/he will be responsible for mobilization of shareholder farmers and regular engagement with them.   The incumbent is expected to drive the egg procurement operations of the FPC & achieve the physical & financial targets S/he will be responsible for sale of inputs to the farmers through the Village Farmer Engagement Centres (VPFEC). S/he will be responsible for optimisation of handling loss S/he would be responsible for procuring the required quality of commodity from designated VPFEC in selected villages S/he would be responsible for managing the handling loss & deterioration of quality of the procured materials  S/he would be responsible for proper & efficient deployment and safe storage of the procurement infrastructure S/he should ensure that the buying of Commodities happens as per the Standard Operating Practices (SOP) laid down by the company at the price determined by the Pricing Committee S/he should ensure the procured commodity is transported from the procurement centre to the Warehouse / Processing unit on time as laid down in the SOP S/he should co-ordinate the farmer-outreach programs.  S/he will be responsible for ensuring the timely availability of inputs & extending agriculture extension services to the members of the company.  S/he should manage the logistics to transport commodities from buying point to Central Warehouse/ processing center.  S/he would be responsible for the variation in quality/quantity between the commodity (Eggs) bought at the procurement centre and that received by the FPC. S/he would also be responsible for the variation in quality/quantity between the inputs supplied by the FPC & that received/stocked at the procurement centre. S/he should coach and guide Sanchalika in best procurement and extension practices, so that the company captures a majority of the marketable surplus from its shareholder farmers. S/he will be responsible for training & capacity building of the Sanchalikas, lead farmers, procurement staff and other stakeholders.  S/he is expected to coordinate the collection of data related to competitor activity disease outbreak, input & output prices, etc and its timely dissemination as easily decipherable action points to the stake holder members. Qualifications Required  Graduate in any subject preferably in Agriculture, Poultry Science, Veterinary Science, or allied subjects is desirable. Preferred work experience: Preference will be given to candidates with Minimum 2-3 years of experience in procuring agri-commodities or sale of inputs to rural farmers. Candidates from Agri input/output industry, Rural marketing from FMCG industry or any other similar industries are encouraged to apply  Ex-service candidates willing are also encouraged to apply.

column2: Role: Procurement Manager Industry: 3PL Contract Logistics (Warehouse) Location : Andheri East "Unlocking the Path to Procurement Excellence: Join Us as the Procurement Manager and Shape the Future of Sourcing!" Position Overview The role of a Manager - Procurement is crucial for ensuring the efficient and cost-effective sourcing of goods and services required for the company's operations. This position plays a significant role in managing the procurement process, optimizing supplier relationships, and controlling costs. You will build & manage Capex / Opex / Admin / IT Peripherals as per the requirement of projects, warehouse, and logistics services. Key Responsibility: 1.  Procurement Strategy:  Develop and implement comprehensive procurement strategies that consider cost-effectiveness, quality assurance, sustainability, and innovation to support the company's growth and operational goals. 2.  Supplier Management:  Lead supplier identification, selection, and negotiation processes. Build and maintain strong relationships with key suppliers, monitor performance, and ensure adherence to contractual agreements. 3.  Sourcing and Purchasing:  Oversee sourcing initiatives, market analysis, and procurement activities to ensure the timely availability of materials, equipment, and services while optimizing costs and maintaining quality standards. 4.  Contract Management:  Collaborate with legal and cross-functional teams to draft, negotiate, and manage contracts and agreements with suppliers. Ensure contracts align with company objectives and mitigate potential risks. 5.  Supply Chain Integration:  Work closely with logistics, operations, and other departments to align procurement activities with production schedules, inventory management, and distribution plans, ensuring seamless coordination across the supply chain. 6.  Risk Mitigation:  Proactively identify and assess potential risks within the supply chain, such as supply disruptions and develop contingency plans to minimize impact on operations. 7.  Data Analysis and Reporting:  Utilize procurement data to generate insightful reports, analyze performance metrics, and provide strategic recommendations for process improvement, cost reduction, and supplier optimization. 8.  Compliance and Ethics:  Ensure procurement practices adhere to relevant regulations, industry standards, and ethical guidelines. Stay informed about industry trends and best practices. 9.  Team Leadership:  Manage and mentor the procurement team, fostering professional growth and ensuring efficient collaboration. Set clear goals, provide guidance, and empower team members to excel. Key KPIs: Cost Determine the profitability and cost effectiveness of procurement investment. Quality  Measure quality performance of supplier. Time  To reduce the cycle time and improve the turnaround time of key activities, improve staff productivity and overall cost of procurement function. Spend Management  Maintain supplier availability to ensure a good functioning of supply chain and greater level of efficiency. Required Qualifications and Skills: 1.  Bachelors degree in Engineering , MBA will be added advantage. 2. Proven experience in 10 years of experience in CAPEX & OPEX purchase., procurement, sourcing, or supply chain management within the logistics industry. 3. Proficiency in using (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) , working exposure of ORACLE Fusion preferred. 4. Good exposure to  Warehouse  market and suppliers

column2: As a Purchase Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing the procurement process, ensuring the timely and cost-effective acquisition of materials, equipment, and services required for various projects      Your role will be crucial in maintaining a smooth workflow and supporting the successful execution of our MEP contracts      The ideal candidate should possess strong negotiation skills, excellent attention to detail, and a deep understanding of the MEP industry        Responsibilities:        Develop and implement effective procurement strategies and policies specific to MEP projects, ensuring compliance with company guidelines and industry regulations.      Identify and source potential suppliers, contractors, and subcontractors for various project requirements, while maintaining a comprehensive supplier database.      Conduct market research to stay up-to-date with the latest trends, pricing, and availability of MEP materials, equipment, and services.      Evaluate supplier capabilities, conduct vendor assessments, and negotiate favorable terms and conditions to ensure competitive pricing, quality, and timely delivery of goods and services.      Collaborate with project managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to determine project material and equipment requirements, providing input on technical specifications, alternatives, and cost-saving opportunities.      Prepare and issue purchase orders, ensuring accuracy, completeness, and adherence to budgetary constraints.      Monitor and track purchase orders, follow up with suppliers to ensure on-time delivery, resolve any delays or issues, and maintain updated records of procurement activities.      Conduct regular supplier performance evaluations, addressing any performance or quality issues, and initiate corrective actions as necessary.      Coordinate with the finance department to ensure accurate and timely processing of invoices, payments, and budget control.      Stay updated with industry regulations, market conditions, and emerging technologies in the MEP field, recommending innovative procurement strategies to optimize processes and reduce costs.        People Management Skills:        Lead, mentor, and supervise a team of procurement professionals, providing guidance, support, and training to enhance their skills and performance.      Set clear performance expectations, establish goals, and provide regular feedback to team members to drive continuous improvement and ensure the achievement of departmental objectives.      Foster a collaborative and inclusive work environment, promoting effective communication and teamwork among team members and other departments.      Resolve conflicts and address employee concerns in a timely and constructive manner, promoting a positive and supportive work culture.      Conduct performance evaluations, identify training needs, and facilitate professional development opportunities to enhance the capabilities and growth of the procurement team.        Requirements:        Bachelors degree in business administration, supply chain management, or a related field. Relevant certifications.      Proven work experience as a Purchase Manager or similar role within the MEP contracting industry.      In-depth knowledge of MEP materials, equipment, and services, and a strong understanding of industry standards and specifications.      Demonstrated ability to develop and implement effective procurement strategies, policies, and procedures.      Proficiency in procurement software and systems, and advanced knowledge of MS Office applications.      Strong negotiation, analytical, and problem-solving skills, with a keen eye for detail.      Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with internal teams, suppliers, and contractors.      Ability to work under pressure, prioritize tasks, and meet tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment.      Familiarity with legal and contractual requirements related to procurement processes.      Strong ethical standards and a commitment to promoting sustainable and socially responsible procurement practices

column2: Job Summary: The Procurement Manager - Capex will be responsible for managing the procurement of capital equipment and services related to the establishment and operation of API manufacturing facilities. This role requires an individual with extensive experience in Capex procurement, particularly for reactors, manufacturing equipment, and other related infrastructure in the chemical or pharmaceutical industries. Key Responsibilities: Capex Procurement Develop and implement procurement strategies for capital equipment and services. Manage the end-to-end procurement process for reactors, manufacturing equipment, and other capital items. Ensure that procurement activities comply with company policies and industry regulations. Negotiate contracts, terms, and conditions with suppliers to secure the best value for the company. Vendor Management: Identify, evaluate, and select suppliers based on quality, cost, and delivery performance. Establish and maintain strong relationships with key suppliers and vendors. Conduct regular performance reviews and audits of suppliers. Resolve any issues or disputes with suppliers promptly and effectively. Budget and Cost Management: Develop and manage the Capex procurement budget. Monitor and report on expenditure against budget, ensuring cost-effective procurement. Identify cost-saving opportunities and implement measures to reduce procurement costs. Project Support: Collaborate with engineering, project management, and other internal teams to support project objectives. Provide procurement expertise and input during project planning and execution phases. Ensure timely delivery of equipment and services to meet project schedules. Compliance and Risk Management Ensure all procurement activities comply with legal, regulatory, and company requirements. Conduct risk assessments and implement mitigation strategies for procurement activities. Maintain accurate and comprehensive procurement records. Continuous Improvement: Implement best practices in Capex procurement and supply chain management. Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance procurement processes and efficiency. Stay abreast of market trends, industry developments, and emerging technologies. Qualifications Bachelors degree in Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, Engineering, or a related field. A Masters degree or higher is preferred. Minimum of 7-10 years of experience in procurement, with a focus on Capex procurement in the pharmaceutical, chemical, or related industry. Proven experience in procuring reactors, manufacturing equipment, and other capital items for API production. Strong knowledge of procurement best practices, contract negotiation, and vendor management. Excellent project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously. Strong analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making abilities. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Preferred Qualifications Professional certification such as CPSM (Certified Professional in Supply Management), CPIM (Certified in Production and Inventory Management), or similar. Experience with ERP systems and procurement software. Knowledge of GMP (Good Manufacturing Practices) and regulatory requirements. Working Conditions This position may require occasional travel to supplier locations and project sites. Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Availability for urgent procurement needs and troubleshooting as required.

column2: ?       Category Strategy Development: Implement the procurement strategy for the Transportation category, aligned with overall business objectives. Analyze market trends, evaluate supplier capabilities, and identify opportunities for cost savings, service improvements, and risk mitigation.     Supplier Relationship Management: Build and maintain strong relationships with transportation service providers, carriers, and third-party logistics (3PL) partners. Negotiate contracts, manage vendor performance, and conduct regular business reviews to ensure optimal service levels, cost competitiveness, and compliance with contractual agreements.     Sourcing and Vendor Selection: Lead end-to-end sourcing activities, including conducting RFIs/RFPs, evaluating proposals, and selecting suitable transportation suppliers. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define requirements, evaluate supplier capabilities, and negotiate pricing and service terms to achieve the best value for the organization.     Contract Management: Develop and manage contracts and agreements with transportation suppliers, ensuring favorable terms, clear performance expectations, and adherence to regulatory and compliance requirements. Monitor contract performance, manage renewals and modifications, and address any disputes or issues that arise.     Cost Optimization: Identify opportunities for cost reduction and efficiency improvement in transportation operations. Analyze freight rates, shipping methods, and transportation routes to optimize costs while maintaining service quality. Implement strategies such as consolidation, mode shifting, and optimization of carrier networks.     Risk Management: Identify and mitigate risks associated with transportation operations, such as capacity constraints, service disruptions, and regulatory compliance. Develop contingency plans and alternative sourcing strategies to minimize supply chain disruptions and ensure continuity of operations.     Performance Monitoring and Reporting: Define key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to track transportation service levels, cost savings, supplier performance, and compliance. Generate regular reports and dashboards to provide visibility to stakeholders and drive data-based decision-making.     Continuous Improvement: Stay abreast of industry trends, new technologies, and best practices in transportation logistics. Lead process improvement initiatives, leverage data analytics, and implement innovative solutions to optimize transportation operations and enhance overall supply chain efficiency       Qualifications:       Bachelors degree in Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, Logistics, or a related field. Advanced degree or relevant certifications (e.g., CSCP, CPSM) are a plus with 5 -6 years of experience.     Proven experience in procurement, sourcing, and supplier management within the transportation category, preferably in a complex and global environment.     In-depth knowledge of transportation logistics, including modes of transportation (road, air, ocean, rail), customs regulations, and freight forwarding processes.     Strong negotiation skills with a track record of achieving cost savings and favorable contractual terms in transportation procurement.     Experience managing relationships with transportation service providers, carriers, and 3PL partners.     Familiarity with transportation management systems (TMS), freight payment systems, and other relevant technology solutions.     Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with proficiency in data analysis and interpretation.     Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders at all levels.     Proven leadership skills with the ability

column2: Role & responsibilities   1. Strategic Sourcing: Develop and implement sourcing strategies for printing materials, paper products, and related supplies, considering factors such as cost, quality, availability, and sustainability. 2. Contract Negotiation: Negotiate favorable terms and conditions, pricing, and payment terms with suppliers, ensuring compliance with company policies and regulatory requirements. Identify and qualify new suppliers, conduct supplier assessments, and maintain relationships with key vendors. 3. Supplier Management: Monitor supplier performance, conduct regular supplier evaluations, and address any issues or concerns related to quality, delivery, or service. Collaborate with suppliers to improve performance, resolve disputes, and implement continuous improvement initiatives. 4. Inventory Management: Coordinate with internal stakeholders to forecast demand, plan inventory levels, and optimize stock levels of raw materials. 5. Cost Optimization: Identify opportunities to reduce procurement costs, streamline processes, and improve efficiency in sourcing, purchasing, and logistics. Analyze spending patterns, benchmark prices, and negotiate volume discounts or rebates to achieve cost savings without compromising quality or service. 6. Compliance and Risk Management: Ensure compliance with relevant laws, regulations, and industry standards related to procurement, including environmental and sustainability requirements. Assess and mitigate risks related to supply chain disruptions, market fluctuations, and geopolitical factors that may impact procurement operations. Preferred candidate profile   As a Procurement Manager specializing in the printing and paper industries, you will be responsible for overseeing the sourcing, purchasing, and procurement activities related to printing materials, paper products, and related supplies. Your role will involve developing and implementing procurement strategies, negotiating contracts with suppliers, and optimizing the procurement process to ensure cost-effectiveness, quality, and timely delivery of materials. Qualifications:  Bachelor's degree in business administration, Supply Chain Management, or a related field. Advanced degree or certification in Procurement or Supply Chain preferred.  6-9 years of experience in procurement, sourcing, or supply chain management, with a background in the printing and paper industries preferred.  Proven track record of success in negotiating contracts, managing supplier relationships, and driving cost savings in procurement operations.  Strong understanding of printing materials, paper products, and related industry trends, technologies, and best practices.  Excellent communication, negotiation, and problem-solving skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with internal stakeholders and external suppliers.  Proficiency in procurement software, ERP systems, and Microsoft Office Suite. Perks and benefits     - Competitive salary commensurate with experience - Paid time off and holidays - Professional development opportunities - Collaborative and supportive work environment
